contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=March 2010}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Big Brother Award.jpg|thumb|right|Big Brother Award, USA sculpture ("If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human faceâ€” forever.")]] --> The '''Big Brother Awards''' recognize "the government and private sector organizations ... which have done the most to threaten [[personal privacy]]". They are named after the [[George Orwell]] character [[Big Brother (1984)|Big Brother]] from the novel ''[[Nineteen Eighty-Four]]''. They are awarded yearly to authorities, companies, organisations, and persons that have been acting particularly and consistently to threaten or violate people's privacy, or disclosed people's [[personal data]] to third parties. The awards are intended to draw public attention to [[privacy]] issues and related alarming trends in society, especially in [[data privacy]]. The contest is organized by a [[nongovernmental organization]] [http://www.iure.org/ Iuridicum remedium]. The German Big Brother Awards are organised and hosted by [[digitalcourage]] (formerly FoeBuD) in [[Bielefeld]]. The United States most recently hosted The Big Brother Awards on April 14th of 2005 in Seattle, WA. They had previously been hosted in Berkeley, CA on the 21st of April, 2004; New York, NY on the 3rd of April, 2003; San Francisco, CA on the 18th of April, 2002; Cambridge on the 7th of March, 2001; and initially in Washington, D.C. on April 7th 1999. ==Countries== The following countries have their own version of the Big Brother Awards: * Big Brother Awards (Austria) * Big Brother Awards (Belgium) * Big Brother Awards (Bulgaria) * [[:cz:Big Brother Awards]] (Czech Republic) * Big Brother Awards (Denmark) * [[Big Brother Awards (Finland)]] * [[:fr:Big Brother Awards]] (France) * [[:de:Big Brother Awards]] (Germany) * Big Brother Awards (Hungary) * Big Brother Awards (Italy) * Big Brother Awards (Japan) (2003) * [[Bits of Freedom#Big Brother Awards|Big Brother Awards (Netherlands)]] * Big Brother Awards (New Zealand) * [[:es:Big Brother Awards]] (Spain) * Big Brother Awards (Switzerland) * [[Big Brother Awards (United Kingdom)]] * [[Big Brother Awards (United States)]] <gallery> File:BigBrotherAwards2008.jpg|Big Brother Award 2008 (Germany) File:PD8513.jpg|Big Brother Awards 2008 (Austria) File:Rop Gonggrijp March 2011.jpg|Big Brother Awards 2010 (Netherlands) File:Big Brother Awards 2013 24.jpg|Big Brother Awards 2013 (France) </gallery> ==References== {{reflist|2}} == See also == * [[Brandeis Award (privacy)]] * [[Mass surveillance]] * [[Orwell Award]] == External links == * [http://www.bigbrotherawards.org International Website about the Big Brother Awards] {{poli-stub}} [[Category:Privacy awards]] [[Category:Ironic and humorous awards]]
